snippet: Corrections appearing in print on October 27, 2011.
By Nuance’s preferred profit measure, the company estimates that it should earn about $125 million this quarter; using standard accounting, the firm is set to lose money for the period.
abstract: Reuters BreakingViews column notes Nuance says its current quarter profit should be about $125 million using its preferred profit measure, but by standard accounting, firm is set to lose money for quarter; holds Spain's banks have big problem with their exposure to real estate.

headline.print_headline: Nuance’s Numbers Do Not Add Up

byline.original: By ROBERT CYRAN and FIONA MAHARG-BRAVO

snippet: The third-largest wireless carrier said it was doing better at keeping and attracting subscribers, as it reported its smallest quarterly loss in four years.
abstract: Sprint Nextel reports third-quarter loss of $301 million, or 10 cents per share, down from loss of $911 million, or 30 cents per share, in year-ago quarter; revenue was $8.3 billion, up 2.2 percent.

headline.main: Sprint Reports Smaller Loss and a Gain in Subscribers
headline.print_headline: Sprint Reports Smaller Loss And a Gain in Subscribers

snippet: Microsoft’s software answer to Android and the iPhone first appeared, incomplete, about a year ago. The blanks have been filled in: speech recognition, Twitter integration and app updates.
Spectators can track runners with the phone application for the Nov. 6 New York City Marathon. They also can use it to find live music or food on the course.
abstract: New York Road Runners Club expands their Mobile Spectator App so that fans can track runners competing in the New York City Marathon on Nov 6; app includes countdown clocks, leader boards, video and the ability to find live music on the course.

headline.main: A Phone App to Keep Fans in Touch
headline.print_headline: A Phone App to Keep Fans in Touch

snippet: In this week’s podcast: Andrea Electronics, Big Data and stylish hard drives.
abstract: In this week’s podcast: Andrea Electronics, Big Data and stylish hard drives.

snippet: There are several apps that help lead the way to that special cup of coffee.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column highlights mobile apps for finding coffee shops.

headline.main: For Coffee Fans, a Collection of Virtual Treasure Maps
headline.print_headline: For Coffee Fans, a Collection of Virtual Treasure Maps

snippet: Yelp is the latest Silicon Valley tech company to put down roots in New York, following in the footsteps of Twitter, Facebook and Google.
abstract: Yelp is the latest Silicon Valley tech company to put down roots in New York, following in the footsteps of Twitter, Facebook and Google.
